articles.author: Joshua Robinson
articles.title: The American Teenager Who Stunned Himself—and the World—to Win Paralympic Gold - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Ezra Frech, a 19-year-old amputee from Los Angeles, planned to run the 100 meters as a warm-up for the high jump. But in the space of 24 hours, he just won both instead.
articles.content: Ezra Frech lined up for his 100-meter final at the Paris Paralympics on Monday knowing precisely what he was there for. This race, he figured, was a warm-up. His real eventthe one where he holds the … [+275 chars]

articles.author: Jamie Carter
articles.title: See Saturn At Its Best And A Moon-Venus View: The Night Sky This Week - Forbes
articles.description: Each Monday, I pick out North America’s celestial highlights for the week ahead (which also apply to mid-northern latitudes in the northern hemisphere).
articles.content:
Saturn in this image from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, taken on July 4, 2020, when the opulent ... [+] giant world was 839 million miles from Earth.
